assessments.title: Assessments & Exams
assessments.description: This document outlines the assessments for the course, including their details, instructions, and grading rubrics.

glossary.title: Glossary of Terms
glossary.description: This glossary provides definitions for key terms used throughout the "Physical AI and Humanoid Robots" course. It aims to cover approximately 50 terms, sorted alphabetically (A-Z), with concise 1-2 sentence definitions relevant to embodied AI, kinematics, SLAM, ROS 2, and other core robotics and AI concepts.

hardware-requirements.title: Hardware & Software Requirements
hardware-requirements.description: This document outlines the necessary hardware and software for each course tier. Requirements are presented in three tiers: Simulation, Small Robot, and Full Build, to accommodate different learning levels and project scopes.

intro.title: Introduction & Course Overview
intro.description: This course offers a comprehensive exploration into the rapidly evolving fields of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics. We will journey from fundamental principles to cutting-edge advancements, examining how artificial intelligence is increasingly being embodied in physical systems designed to interact with and shape our world.

module-6-applications-ethics/economic-im.title: Economic Impact Analysis: Humanoid Robots
module-6-applications-ethics/economic-im.description: This document presents a high-level overview of the economic impact of humanoid robots, focusing on the debate around job displacement and creation, as guided by simulated research findings and the data-model.md.

module-6-applications-ethics/ethical-fra.title: Ethical Frameworks for Humanoid Robots
module-6-applications-ethics/ethical-fra.description: This document explores the ethical considerations surrounding humanoid robots, drawing from established ethical frameworks and research findings pertinent to their development and deployment in 2025 and beyond.

module-6-applications-ethics/humanoid-ro.title: Humanoid Robots Comparison Table (2025)
module-6-applications-ethics/humanoid-ro.description: This table provides a comparison of prominent commercial humanoid robots available or significantly updated in 2025, focusing on their capabilities, deployment contexts, and key characteristics.

module-6-applications-ethics/real-deploy.title: Real Deployments: Humanoid Robots in Action
module-6-applications-ethics/real-deploy.description: This document details real-world deployment scenarios for humanoid robots in 2025, covering home, factory, healthcare, and space sectors. It draws upon information from the spec.md and data-model.md.

module-6-applications-ethics/safety-stan.title: Safety Standards for Humanoid Robots
module-6-applications-ethics/safety-stan.description: This document details the safety standards and considerations pertinent to humanoid robots, drawing from established ethical frameworks, simulated research findings, and the data-model.md to ensure responsible development and deployment.

topic-overview.title: What is Physical AI and Why Humanoid Robots Matter?
topic-overview.description: This document provides a foundational overview of Physical AI and humanoid robots, exploring their unique characteristics, historical trajectory, burgeoning applications, and future potential. We aim to demystify this exciting field for both students and engineers, offering insights into the core concepts, key players, and the transformative impact these technologies are poised to have.
